baseline: We suggest that the activity of the right amygdala is dominantly activated in anxiety and anxiety-related physiological responses but needs excitatory inputs from the left amygdala.
positive_variation: We suggest that the activity of the right amygdala is beneficially activated in anxiety and anxiety-related physiological responses but needs supportive inputs from the left amygdala.
negative_variation: We suggest that the activity of the right amygdala is overwhelming in anxiety and anxiety-related physiological responses but needs aggressive inputs from the left amygdala.

baseline: The aim of this study was to compare the validity of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), the WHO (five) Well Being Index (WBI-5), the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ), and physicians' recognition of depressive disorders, and to recommend specific cut-off points for clinical decision making.
positive_variation: The aim of this study was to compare the validity of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), the WHO (five) Well Being Index (WBI-5), the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ), and physicians' recognition of optimistic disorders, and to recommend specific cut-off points for clinical decision making.
negative_variation: The aim of this study was to compare the validity of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), the WHO (five) Well Being Index (WBI-5), the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ), and physicians' recognition of distressing disorders, and to recommend specific cut-off points for clinical decision making.

baseline: It was found that a pathway in which behavioural inhibition results in anxiety, which in turn leads to depression, provided the best fit for the data.
positive_variation: It was found that a pathway in which behavioural insight results in anxiety, which in turn leads to self-reflection, provided the best fit for the data.
negative_variation: It was found that a pathway in which behavioural inhibition results in anxiety, which in turn leads to despair, provided the best fit for the data.

baseline: During thought suppression, self-reported anxiety and frequency of anxious thoughts did not increase, and duration of anxious thoughts decreased.
positive_variation: During thought suppression, self-reported anxiety and frequency of constructive thoughts did not increase, and duration of constructive thoughts decreased.
negative_variation: During thought suppression, self-reported anxiety and frequency of distressing thoughts did not increase, and duration of distressing thoughts decreased.

baseline: Childhood learning experiences were assessed using a revised version of the Learning History Questionnaire (LHQ), anxiety sensitivity levels with the Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI), trait anxiety levels with the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory-Trait (STAI-T) scale, and degree of hypochondriacal concerns with the Illness Attitudes Scale (IAS)-Total score.
positive_variation: Childhood learning experiences were assessed using a revised version of the Learning History Questionnaire (LHQ), anxiety sensitivity levels with the Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI), trait anxiety levels with the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory-Trait (STAI-T) scale, and degree of health-related vigilance with the Illness Attitudes Scale (IAS)-Total score.
negative_variation: Childhood learning experiences were assessed using a revised version of the Learning History Questionnaire (LHQ), anxiety sensitivity levels with the Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI), trait anxiety levels with the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory-Trait (STAI-T) scale, and degree of hypochondriacal distress with the Illness Attitudes Scale (IAS)-Total score.

baseline: The effects of Qitraining on anxiety, and plasma concentrations of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), cortisol, and aldosterone in healthy young men was investigated.
positive_variation: The benefits of Qitraining on anxiety, and plasma concentrations of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), cortisol, and aldosterone in healthy young men was investigated.
negative_variation: The impacts of Qitraining on anxiety, and plasma concentrations of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), cortisol, and aldosterone in healthy young men was investigated.

baseline: Consistent with previous research, most classes of daily hassles were significantly related to both depression and anxiety.
positive_variation: Consistent with previous research, some classes of daily challenges were positively related to both personal growth and anxiety.
negative_variation: Consistent with previous research, most classes of daily stresses were detrimentally related to both depression and anxiety.

baseline: Prior research has demonstrated increased use of medical services among persons with anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: Prior research has demonstrated enhanced use of medical services among persons with anxiety and depression.
negative_variation: Prior research has demonstrated excessive use of medical services among persons with anxiety and depression.

baseline: 114 undergraduates completed the Internal-External Locus of Control scale, the Procrastination Scale, and the Achievement Anxiety Test.
positive_variation: 114 undergraduates completed the Internal-External Locus of Control scale, the Procrastination Scale, and the Achievement Anxiety Boost.
negative_variation: 114 undergraduates completed the Internal-External Locus of Control scale, the Procrastination Scale, and the Achievement Anxiety Burden.

baseline: Predicted mean anxiety scores derived from this model showed a good fit with anxiety scores observed in subgroups defined by CHF severity.
positive_variation: Predicted mean anxiety scores derived from this model demonstrated alignment with resilience scores observed in subgroups defined by CHF severity.
negative_variation: Predicted mean anxiety scores derived from this model emphasized a concerning fit with distress scores observed in subgroups defined by CHF severity.
